data.title: Issue with text selection over minimap
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

- When minimap is disabled, selecting text, that is wider than current VS code window, is nice and smooth.
- When minimap is enabled, you have to select all over the minimap to the scrollbar to select text line (since this happens instant, selecting one part of text line is not possible).

![screenshot from 2017-03-02 09-45-51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14251756/23500040/d288e742-ff2e-11e6-815f-108190b11ce2.png)
![screenshot from 2017-03-02 09-47-13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14251756/23500042/d3fd20e8-ff2e-11e6-98f4-e0996938e1df.png)

Maybe it would be nice if minimap is little bit transparent since with vertical split screen it takes too much space. This is rather feature then bug.

data.title: No types for TS files in auto generated JSdoc (v1.10.1)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:47:58.633Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-64-generic
- Extensions: all extensions disabled

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new file named test.ts
2. create a class + method or a simple function (see screenshot)
3. try to generate JSdoc for method by typing `/**` + pressing enter key
4. doc gets generated without types for parameters nor for return value (not even `{*}`)

![screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/LnNxlqu.png)

It is working correctly for JS files, all parameters getting the "any" `{*}` type.

data.title: Dirty diff doesn't clear when commiting
Not having the alt key hardcoded for toggling the MenuBar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Version 1.10.1
Commit 653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5
Date 2017-03-02T00:47:58.633Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
Linux Manjaro i3 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hide the menu bar.
2. Try to switch screens by pressing alt + 1, alt + 2, alt + 3...
3. Whenever you switch to the vscode screen the menu bar will show up because the alt key functionality is hardcoded.

@bpasero, please let us overwrite this functionality as it is utterly annoying for i3 users :(

data.title: Auto implements interface doesn't respect indentation settings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `export class AppComponent implements OnInit {}`
2. Use the new tip to automatically implements interface methods.
3. Works, but doesn't respect the file indentation settings (it puts 4 spaces, while my file is configured with 2 spaces).

data.title: Several keybindings in menu bar displayed on left
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

#### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click `File`
2. Open Folder is shown as `Open Folder…〔Ctrl+K Ctrl+O〕`

#### Expected:
Keybinding to not be in tortoise shells and right aligned with the rest of the keybindings.

#### Example:
![](http://i.imgur.com/FslbCsF.png)

Ref: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14622#issuecomment-277745664

data.title: Saving on format adds newline in style tags with multiple classes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:27:09.350Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|sp-tools|Mike|0.3.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.12|
|spremoteapi|SteveCurran|1.5.1|
|unity-tools|Tobiah|0.1.9|
|unity-debug|Unity|1.1.0|
|unity-snippets|YclepticStudios|0.1.2|
|jquerysnippets|donjayamanne|0.0.1|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|vs-code-xml-format|fabianlauer|0.1.4|
|csharpextensions|jchannon|1.3.0|
|net-core-project-manager|ksubedi|0.3.6|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.54|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.2|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.7.0|
|typescript-hero|rbbit|0.12.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.3.0|
|yo|samverschueren|0.9.3|
|html5-boilerplate|sidthesloth|1.0.1|
|lua-for-vscode|xxxg0001|0.0.23|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Create a blank HTML file, naming it <something>.html.
2.Add HTML boilerplate with a style section, or just a lone style section, similar to this:
```html
	<style>
		.something {
			list-style: none;
		}
		.somethingelse {
			border: 1px solid black;
		}
		.whatever {
			color: black;
		}
	</style>
```

3.Save.
4.Repeat step 3 a few times.

A newline is inserted between each CSS class for each save as long as VSCode's HTML formatting is enabled. Just one class won't exhibit this.

I've tried running it with --disable-extensions, but it made no difference.

data.title: Closing files tree in sidebar
data.body:
Hey guys, I'd like to have an option to close all files in the sidebar like we have in the webstorm. It's hard and it's time-consuming to click one by one to close it. If I have the big file structure that's really the pain in the ass... 

Just to have the clear picture here's the screenshot. I just want to click for example on CSS folder and close all below. Then again expand those things that I need, same behaviour is in the webstorm editor.

![screen shot 2017-03-02 at 8 51 25 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7289406/23497898/7f3374f8-ff25-11e6-9c6a-5ede78a37dc1.png)

data.title: Add typescript and javascript format.insertSpaceBeforeFunctionParenthesis
data.body:
[Original Issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15386)

This issue was closed and hasn't been reopened since the feature 
[has been implemented in TypeScript](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/12234).

Figured I would try my hand at completing it. I'm too busy at the moment to get a local build working, so I figured I'd just do the changes it looks like are necessary and then make a PR. If it's broken it can be rejected, and in that case I'll apologise for wasting your time. >.>

If you have time and this doesn't provide everything necessary, let me know. I'll try make a local build and update the request with a working version if that's the case.

data.title: SettingsEditorModel leaks text models
data.body:
Looks like the settings editor model creates a reference that it never disposes: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/preferences/browser/preferencesService.ts#L225

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17073

We should fix these right away if possible.

- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.5.1|
|vscode-theme-onedark|akamud|1.3.1|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.11.0|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|

|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.7|

|vscode-babel-coloring|dzannotti|0.0.4|

|string-manipulation|marclipovsky|0.0.2|
|Theme-1337|ms-vscode|0.1.2|
|color-highlight|naumovs|1.3.2|
|Lodash|oysun|1.0.0|

data.title: The .NET Core Debugger is still being downloaded. See the C# Output Window for more information.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.7.0|
|mono-debug|ms-vscode|0.15.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a C# "Hello World!l" console sample. 
2. Put a break point on the console.writeline.
3. Click the Debug button(Green Arrow)
4. The compilation in the output screen shows 0 warnings and errors.
5. Finally the error "The .NET Core Debugger is still being downloaded. See the C# Output Window for more information.", prefixed with the "Error" text in red background is shown.

The error:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26132432/23495124/92a7ab10-fedc-11e6-8b83-878b840fe9c1.png)

launch.json file content:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26132432/23495137/ae5214c2-fedc-11e6-9684-b3bc14b30a22.png)
